text:
When either stopping the Apache service (via the Command Prompt) or simply
shutting down Windows 2000 itself, I get the following message:

The instruction at "0x77a52c69" referenced memory at "0x00000004".
The memory could not be "written".
Click on OK to terminate the program

I'm running Windows 2000 SP3 with all hotfixes to date.
creator: neilturner@eircom.net

text:
Very odd.  Do you have any third party modules loaded?

  Try disabling them and report back if this resolves the bug.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
neilturner@eircom.net
text:
The only module loaded was the PHP module, which I have now commented out (I use
PHP 4.2.2 at the moment).

As the error does not occur every time I shutdown the service or restart Windows
2000, I'll continue to test and report back at a later date.

Waiting for further details... please reopen this bug if you continue to
  experience problems without PHP loaded.  You are also better off moving
  to Apache 2.0.46, as many more developers are paying attention to the 2.0
  activity, and much more attention has been paid to threading issues (which
  is a huge benefit to Win32 users.)
creator: wrowe@apache.org
